Regulation Name(s): Fully automated short-term incubation cycle antimicrobial susceptibility system
Analyte(s): Carbapenemase (Ambler Class A, Class B, Class D)
Method(s)/Technology(ies): Modified Carbapenem Inactivation Method (mCIM, phenotypic reference)
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System and BD Phoenix CPO detect - GN for rapid identification and antimicrobial susceptibility testing of Gram-negative bacteria including carbapenemase detection and Ambler classification
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for rapid in vitro identification and quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility by MIC for Gram Negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria and phenotypic detection of carbapenemase production including Ambler classification in Enterobacteriaceae, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, and Acinetobacter baumannii.
